alert.note: Alert for Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Grand Valley; Grand and Battlement Mesas; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 8:14PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Mesa County through 845 PM MDT... At 811 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms 13 miles south of Grand Junction, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grand Junction, Orchard Mesa, Whitewater, Glade Park, Clifton and Redlands. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 53. Colorado 141 between mile markers 121 and 122, and between mile markers 136 and 161. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
